alert.note: Alert for Allen; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 1:02PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Woodson, northeastern Greenwood and Allen Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 102 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Neosho Falls to 7 miles southeast of Madison. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Iola, Humboldt, Yates Center, La Harpe, Gas, Neosho Falls, Bassett, Batesville, Iola Airport, Petrolia, Rose and Piqua. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
